intro: Polygala lasseniana, commonly known as the Lassen's milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its small, intricate flowers that resemble those of the genus Milkvetch. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and gray-green, while its flowers are often pale pink or white. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological niche.
